title: Looks like an early 80s fantasy type to me.
content:
Saw this image in the 95.7 KJR facebook feed, but have no additional information about the font. Thanks for helping me out.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725184404im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FsBOwF6_4635.jpg)
author: Verisian

comments.content:
This is a 19th century font patented by Herman Ihlenburg on October 6, 1891 and sold by MacKellar, Smiths Jordan, and other foundries as \_Columbian\_. Digital versions, compiled by the \_Solopedia\_, include P22 Victorian Swash [http://www.fonts.com/font/p22/p22-victorian/swash](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725184404/http:/www.fonts.com/font/p22/p22-victorian/swash "http://www.fonts.com/font/p22/p22-victorian/swash") and [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/victorian-gothic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725184404/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/victorian-gothic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/victorian-gothic/") Glorietta (Solotype), Trinigan FG (Fontgrube), Goodfellow (Scriptorium), Bluegum Forest (Tris Nguyen, corrected by MEG). Burton'sNightmare (anon).  
Don  
NOTE: corrected post
